reasoning: Infantile capillary hemangioma is the most common vascular tumor in infants with incidence approximately 1200-1500 per 100k live births. Prevalence at 2-3 years of age approximately 2500 per 100k. Data from pediatric dermatology and vascular surgery literature.
source: Bruckner AL, Frieden IJ (2003). Hemangiomas of infancy. J Am Acad Dermatol. 48(4):477-498
